<Row className="resource-card-group">
<Column colMd={4} colLg={4} noGutterSm>
    <ResourceCard
      subTitle="Setup the IBM Design Kit"
      aspectRatio="2:1"
      actionIcon="launch"
      href="https://github.com/IBM/carbon-elements/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md"
      >

</ResourceCard>
</Column>
<Column colMd={4} colLg={4} noGutterSm>
    <ResourceCard
      subTitle="Color Palettes for Adobe™ (.ase)"
      actionIcon="launch"
      aspectRatio="2:1"
      href="https://github.com/IBM/carbon-elements/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md"
      >
This is the logotype for IBM Services. It is the primary identifier of our brand, and should be treated with respectappear in black or reversed to white on dark backgrounds.
When using the logotyp e, it must appear in th e context of the IBM master brand. Specifically, the IBM 8-bar logo should be featured with the IBM  Services logotype in all communications.

The IBM Services brand focuses primarily on the blue and gray values within the IBM color palette. While all blues and grays are available for use, the core colors for IBM Services are Black, Blue 80, Blue 60 and White.
Additional colors from the IBM palette may be used as accents when needed. The complete IBM color palette is shown on the following page.

There are specific offerings and practices that are approved as lockups with IBM Services, and there are type treatment specifications for doing so consis ten tly Every name that includes "Services" offers the oppor tunity to portray the
dist inct value of our offerings and practices, while also helping others navigate the Service s portfolio. For additional guidance on naming, please contact IBM Services Brand Forum
